source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經
translation: Sutra on the Nine Colored Deer

source_sentence: 吳月氏優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 佛言：「昔者，菩薩身為九色鹿；其毛九種色，其角白如雪，常在恒水邊飲食水草，常與一烏為知識。
translation: The Buddha said, "Once upon a time, the bodhisattva was a nine-colored deer with fur of nine different colors and horns as white as snow that used to eat water and grass at the edge of constant water and was always in the company of a crow as a friend.

source_sentence: 「時，水中有溺人隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：『山神、樹神、諸天龍神，何不愍傷我也？』
translation: "When a submerged person in the water came down with the current, sometimes emerging or submerging, they got caught in a tree and looked up and called to the gods, 'Why don't you pity me, mountain gods, tree gods, and gods of gods and dragons?'

source_sentence: 鹿聞人喚聲，即走往水邊，語溺人言：『汝可勿怖！
translation: When the deer heard the call, it went to the water's edge and said to the submerged man, 'Don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 汝可騎我背、捉我角，我相負出上岸。』
translation: You may ride on my back and grab my horns, and I'll carry you out onto the shore.'

source_sentence: 「鹿大疲極，溺人下地，繞鹿三匝，向鹿叩頭，乞為大家作奴，給其使令採取水草。
translation: "The deer was so exhausted that the drowned man went down to the ground, circled the deer three times, bowed his head to it, and begged to be made a slave of the others and given orders to take water and grass.

source_sentence: 鹿言：『不用卿也，且各自去，欲報恩者，莫得道我在此間，人貪我皮角，必來殺我。』
translation: The deer said, 'You're not needed; go your separate ways; if you want to repay a kindness, don't tell them I'm here; people who crave my skin and horns will surely come and kill me.'

source_sentence: 於是，溺者受教而去。
translation: The drowning man then accepted the teaching and departed.

source_sentence: 「爾時，國王夫人夜夢見九色鹿，意欲得其皮角，即託病不起。
translation: "It was then that the king's wife saw a nine-colored deer in a nighttime dream, intending to obtain its hide and horns, and she took ill and didn't come home.

source_sentence: 王問夫人言：『何以不起？』
translation: The king asked the lady, 'Why can't you get up?'

source_sentence: 「夫人答言：『昨夜夢見非常鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪，我思得其皮作衣裘、其角作拂柄，王當為我得之，王若不得，我當死矣。』
translation: "The lady answered, 'Last night I dreamt I saw a wonderful deer with fur nine different colors and horns as white as snow; I thought I could get its hide to make a fur coat and its horns to make a handle; the king would get them for me; if he didn't, I would die.'

source_sentence: 「王告夫人：『汝為且起，我作一國王，何所不得？』
translation: "The king told the lady, 'Why don't you get up, for I'll be king of a country, and why wouldn't I get it?'

source_sentence: 「王即便募於國中：『若有能得九色鹿者，當與分國治，賜其金鉢盛滿銀粟，賜其銀鉢盛滿金粟。』
translation: "The king then summoned the kingdom, 'If someone can obtain a deer with nine colors, they will be given a share of the country's government, a gold bowl full of silver and a silver bowl full of gold.'

source_sentence: 「溺人聞王募重，心生惡念：『我說此鹿可得富貴，鹿是畜生，死活何在？』
translation: "When the drowning man heard that the king was asking for more, he had a bad thought: 'I said this deer would bring wealth and prosperity; it's an animal, so what's the point of dying or living?'

source_sentence: 便語募人言：『我知有九色鹿處。』
translation: He then said to the recruiter, 'I know where there are the nine colored deer.'

source_sentence: 「募人便將至王所言：『此人知有九色鹿處。』
translation: "The recruiter then went to the king and said, 'This man knows where there are the nine colored deer.'

source_sentence: 「王聞大歡喜，王言：『汝得其皮角來，報之半國。』
translation: "The king was greatly delighted when he heard that, and he said, 'Get his hide and horns and send them back to half the country.'

source_sentence: 「於是，溺人面上即生癩瘡。
translation: "Then, the drowning man's face immediately became scabby.

source_sentence: 溺人言：『此鹿雖是畜生，大有威神，王宜多將人兵，乃可得耳。』
translation: The drowning man said, 'Although this deer is an animal, it's quite powerful; the king should send a large force of men to get it.'

source_sentence: 「王即大出人兵往恒水邊。
translation: "The king then sent out a large army of men to the edge of the Gaṅgā River.

source_sentence: 烏在樹上遙見王人眾來，疑當殺鹿，即呼鹿言：『且起！
translation: When Uṣa saw the king's army coming from a tree, he suspected that he would kill the deer and called to the deer, saying, 'Get up!'

source_sentence: 王來取汝。』
translation: The king has come to get you.'

source_sentence: 鹿故熟臥不覺，烏復言：『知識且起。
translation: The deer was therefore lying down unaware, but Crow also said, 'Get up, you!

source_sentence: 王將兵至。』
translation: The king's army is coming.'

source_sentence: 鹿故復不覺，烏便下樹，居其頭上、啄其耳：『知識且起！
translation: The deer then again didn't realize it, so the crow descended from the tree, sat on its head, and pecked its ear, saying, 'Get up, you know!'

source_sentence: 王兵圍汝數重。』
translation: The king's troops have surrounded you several times.'

source_sentence: 「鹿方驚起，四顧望視，無復走地，便往趣王車邊。
translation: "The deer then got up in fear, looked around, didn't walk off the ground again, and went to the king's chariot.

source_sentence: 傍人引弓欲射之，王告：『莫射此鹿，此鹿非常，將是天神耶！』
translation: When a man nearby drew his bow to shoot it, the king told him, 'Don't shoot this deer; it's extraordinary, for it will be a god!'

source_sentence: 鹿即言：『莫射殺我，假我須臾，我有恩於國。』
translation: The deer then said, 'Don't shoot me to kill me; give me a moment, for I have a favor to the kingdom.'

source_sentence: 王問：『有何恩？』
translation: The king asked, 'What kindness?'

source_sentence: 『我曾活王國中一人。』
translation: 'I was once one of the living kingdoms.'

source_sentence: 即長跪，重問王：『誰道我在此？』
translation: He knelt down long and repeatedly asked the king, 'Who told you that I was here?'

source_sentence: 王言：『車邊癩面人也。』
translation: The king said, 'He's a bald-faced man on the edge of a chariot.'

source_sentence: 「鹿舉頭看此人，眼中淚出，不能自勝：『大王！
translation: "The deer lifted its head to look at this man, and tears welled up in its eyes as it couldn't bring itself to say, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 此人本溺在水中，隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：「山神、樹神、諸天龍神，何不愍傷我？」
translation: Originally submerged in water, this man came down with the current, sometimes emerging or submerging, and got hold of a tree. He looked up and called to the gods, "Why don't you pity me, mountain gods, tree gods, and the gods of the gods and dragons?"

source_sentence: 我時不惜此命，自投水中，負此人出，本要誓不相道；人無反覆，不如水中浮木也。』
translation: I wouldn't have spared my life if I'd thrown myself into the water and carried this man out, for I would have vowed not to share the same path; a person without reversion is no better than a floating log in the water.'

source_sentence: 「王聞鹿言，有慙愧色：『我民無義。』
translation: "When the king heard what the deer said, he looked shocked and embarrassed, 'My people have no purpose.'

source_sentence: 王即三教其民：『奈何！
translation: The king then instructed his people three times, 'What should we do?'

source_sentence: 奈何！
translation: Nah!

source_sentence: 受恩反欲殺之？』
translation: Do you accept a favor and want to kill him?'

source_sentence: 王即放鹿使去：『下國中，若有驅逐此鹿者，當誅汝五屬。』
translation: The king then released the deer and sent the envoy away, saying, 'If anyone in the next country drives this deer, your five subordinates will be executed.'

source_sentence: 於是，王便還宮。
translation: Thereupon, the king returned to the palace.

source_sentence: 鹿歸故處。
translation: The deer returned to its former location.

source_sentence: 「是時，國中眾鹿皆來依附，數千為群，永不見害，共飲食水草，不犯人菜穀；從是之後，風雨以時，五穀豐熟，民無疾病，其時太平，畢命化去。」
translation: "After that, the deer in the country all came to rely on them, forming herds of thousands, never seeing any harm, eating together of water and grass, and not taking prisoners' grains; after that, the winds and rains rained at regular intervals, the grains were plentiful, the people had no illness, and the time was peaceful, and their lives were spent in transformation."

source_sentence: 佛告諸弟子：「菩薩所行，雖處畜生不捨於慈，人獸竝度。
translation: The Buddha told his disciples, "A bodhisattva's practice is to go along with animals and not abandon kindness, saving both humans and animals.

source_sentence: 「是時夫人者，孫陀利是也；是時烏者，阿難是也；是溺人者，調達是也；時鹿者，我身是也。
translation: "At the time, that lady was Sundarī; that crow was Ānanda; that drowning man was Tathāgata; and that deer was myself.

source_sentence: 調達與我世世有怨；阿難有至意得道。」
translation: Tathāgata and I have had enemies from generation to generation, and Ānanda had the ultimate intention to attain the Way."

source_sentence: 菩薩更勤苦行波羅蜜，忍辱如是。
translation: The bodhisattva further diligently practices the perfection of austerity and tolerates thusness.

source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經
translation: The Sutra of the Nine-Colored Deer
